definitions.definition: an organ of soft nervous tissue contained in the skull of vertebrates, functioning as the coordinating center of sensation and intellectual and nervous activity.
examples: cerebrum, cerebral matter, encephalon; gray matter the disease attacks certain cells in the brain

definitions.definition: the substance of an animal's brain used as food.
an electronic device with functions comparable to those of the human brain.

examples: I didn't have enough brains for the sciences
synonyms: savvy; smarts "success requires brains as well as brawn"

definitions.definition: a clever person who supplies the ideas and plans for a group of people.
examples: noun: brains; plural noun: the brains
a tiny alarm bell began to ring in her brain
he was known more as a snappy dresser than a brain

definitions.definition: hit (someone) hard on the head with an object.
examples: she brained me with a rolling pin
